metadata.title: Friday, 14th February, 2014
metadata.session: THIRD SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

parts: (a)    when the Musele-Matebo Game Management Area (GMA) will commence operations;
(b)    who will manage the GMA; and
(c)    what has caused the delay in the GMA commencing operations.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    how many canals in Western Province were cleared between 2010 and 2013, year by year;
(b)    of the cleared canals, how many were in Kalabo Central Parliamentary Constituency;
(c)    what the total cost of clearing the canals in Western Province in 2013 was; and
(d)    when the canals in Kalabo District will next be cleared.

questions.minister: Minister of Local Government and Housing
parts: (a)    why the street lighting project in Kalabo Central Parliamentary Constituency has stalled;
(b)    when the works on the project will resume;
(c)    what the time-frame for completing the project is;
(d)    what the cost of the project is; and
(e)    whether the distance between the street light poles meets the minimum standards and, if not, why.

questions.minister: Minister of Local Government and Housing
parts: (a)    what progress, with regard to infrastructure development at the Mwandi District Headquarters, has been made; and
(b)    when staff for Mwandi District Council will be employed.
(a)    what the approved establishment for police officers in Luapula Province is, district by district;
(b)    whether all the positions on the establishment are filled;
(c)    if not, what plans the Government has, to deploy more police officers in the Province; and
(d)    what the establishment for Ndola and Kitwe Districts is, in comparison to Luapula Province.
(a)    when the Agricultural  Credits Act of 2010 will be implemented; and
(b)    why the Act has not been implemented since its enactment in 2010.
(a)    what the reasons for retrenching all cordon guides along the cordon line on the Zambia/Angola Border are;
(b)    what the status of the Contagious Bovine Pleuropneumonia (CBPP) in the Western Province was, as of October, 2013; and
(c)    when the ban on transporting cattle from Western Province to Lusaka and Copperbelt Provinces will be lifted.
(a)    whether the money appropriated in the 2011 budget for the rehabilitation of Sishekanu Local Court in Liuwa Parliamentary Constituency was disbursed;
(b)    if the money was disbursed, what has caused the delay in commencing the rehabilitation works; and
(c)    when rehabilitation works will commence.

questions.minister: Minister of Health when the Government  will start providing free health services to the aged and the disabled   citizens.
